item.title: How To Watch the 2025 Chicago Cubs Season
item.dc:creator: Taylor Kujawa
item.description:
The 2025 Chicago Cubs season marks the 154th chapter of this storied franchise. After a challenging 2024 campaign, manager Craig Counsell now faces the crucial task of getting the Cubs back to the MLB Playoffs.

The post How To Watch the 2025 Chicago Cubs Season appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
Stream Free on DIRECTV

The 2025 Chicago Cubs season marks the 154th chapter of this storied franchise. After a challenging 2024 campaign, manager Craig Counsell now faces the crucial task of getting the Cubs back to the MLB Playoffs.

This year, in-market games will continue airing on Marquee Sports Network—the exclusive home for Cubs action since 2020. Marquee is available as a standalone streaming subscription and through various TV providers, ensuring local fans get the best coverage.

With renewed energy and the potential for a playoff push, it’s time to rally behind the Cubbies. Keep reading to learn how to watch the Chicago Cubs live on TV this season, from Wrigley Field showdowns to thrilling road games.

Jump to:

  • Chicago Cubs channels
  • Chicago Cubs TV schedule
  • Chicago Cubs Spring Training schedule
  • Watch the Chicago Cubs for free

Don’t miss the Chicago Cubs on TV

Gear up for yearlong baseball action, from Spring Training to the World Series. Enter your zip code below to see the best TV and internet providers in your area.

What channels have Chicago Cubs games?

Most Chicago Cubs games air locally on Marquee Sports Network, except for select nationally televised matchups. Those games air nationwide on FOX, FS1, ESPN, TBS, and MLB Network, with some streaming on Apple TV+ and The Roku Channel.

Out-of-market viewers need MLB.TV or MLB EXTRA INNINGS to watch the Marquee Sports Network games. But some out-of-market matchups also stream on ESPN+.

Pro tip: MLB At Bat has home and away audio broadcasts of every Chicago Cubs game without blackout restrictions. You can also listen to games on select AM and FM stations across the Midwest via the Chicago Cubs Radio Network.

2025 Chicago Cubs playoff TV schedule

The Chicago Cubs began the 2025 season with the two-game MLB Tokyo Series against the Los Angeles Dodgers at Tokyo Dome in Japan. After the brief international tour, the Cubs returned stateside for more preseason action before the regular season proper began on March 27.

As the season unfolds, you can expect thrilling matchups against National League rivals and American League powerhouses. So, mark your calendars because we’ve laid out the full TV schedule below, complete with start times and channel listings.

The games to watch right now are part of the best-of-three National League Wild Card series against the San Diego Padres.

How to watch Chicago Cubs Spring Training games

Marquee Sports Network will broadcast the majority of the Chicago Cubs’ Spring Training games, including most Sloan Park matchups. Depending on your location, select games may also air live on MLB Network.

The 2025 Cactus League kicks off on Thursday, February 20, when the Cubs take on the Los Angeles Dodgers. I’m especially excited about this matchup since the Cubs and Dodgers will face off again in mid-March during the MLB Tokyo Series.

With a jam-packed spring schedule featuring 29 games—including split-squad contests, exhibition matches in Tokyo, and two MLB Spring Breakout games—this preseason promises plenty of action to gear us up for the regular season. Check out the full Cubs Spring Training TV schedule below.

How to watch the Chicago Cubs for free

*CableTV.com utilizes paid Amazon links. Amazon.com Price; $46.99 (as of 7/25/25 11:20 a.m. CT). Read full disclaimer.

You can use an over-the-air (OTA) antenna to catch some Chicago Cubs games on FOX for free this season. Antennas aren’t free, but you don’t need a TV subscription. Just use the FCC’s Reception Map Tool to check your area’s channels. Then, visit our Best OTA Antennas page for recommendations like the Mohu Leaf 50, which is ideal for suburban households.

Another viewing option is the Free Game of the Day on MLB.TV. Create an account on MLB.com to stream a free game each day of the regular season, but be aware of potential regional blackouts.

You can also try a free live TV streaming trial from services like DIRECTV STREAM, Fubo, and YouTube TV. Our top pick for MLB action is DIRECTV STREAM, which has core national channels and most RSNs—including Marquee Sports Network and Chicago Sports Network.

How to watch the Chicago Cubs FAQ

What streaming service has Chicago Cubs games?

Most live TV streaming services have Cubs games, but DIRECTV STREAM is our favorite because of its national and in-market coverage. MLB.TV is available for streaming out-of-market games, while Apple TV+ shows exclusive matches.

How can I watch Marquee without cable?

You can watch Marquee Sports Network without cable via a standalone online subscription for $19.99 per month. The channel is also available through DIRECTV STREAM and Fubo, but you must live within the Cubs TV territory to watch live in-market games.

Can I watch Cubs games on Amazon Prime?

Yes, out-of-market Cubs fans can watch games on Amazon Prime Video by getting an MLB.TV subscription through Prime Video Channels.

Are Cubs games on Sling TV?

Yes, you can watch nationally televised Cubs games on Sling TV. But you’ll need the Sling Orange + Blue plan to get ESPN and FOX Sports channels together. MLB Network and MLB Network Strike Zone are available in the Sports Extra add-on.

Where can I watch the Iowa Cubs game?

Some Iowa Cubs games air on Marquee Sports Network. But most Minor League Baseball games stream on MLB At Bat via MLB.TV—including most matchups featuring the Cubs’ Triple-A affiliate.

Why you should trust us

Our sports experts listed every Chicago Cubs game this season and researched local and national broadcast details. Using that information, we chose the best TV services for watching games by analyzing prices, channel guides, and ease of use.

Check out our How We Rank page to learn more about our methods.

item.title: How To Watch the 2025 San Diego Padres Season
item.dc:creator: Chantel Buchi
item.description:
Learn how to watch every San Diego Padres game on TV this MLB season with our viewing guide—featuring game times, channel listings, and more.

The post How To Watch the 2025 San Diego Padres Season appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
Stream Free on DIRECTV

Friar Faithful, the 2025 MLB postseason is here, and I’ve got everything you need to watch the San Diego Padres for their entire playoff run. Their first top is the National League Wild Card series against the Chicago Cubs.

The Padres are coming off a strong 93-win season in 2024. Can they make it further than last year? Check out my full watch guide and keep checking in as San Diego makes its way through the playoffs.

Jump to:

  • San Diego Padres channels
  • San Diego Padres TV schedule
  • Spring Training schedule
  • Watch the Padres for free

Want more TV sports coverage?

Subscribe to CableTV.com’s email newsletter for the latest event-viewing guides, entertaining takes, and money-saving promotions.

By signing up, you agree to our Privacy Policy & Terms and Conditions.

Which channels have San Diego Padres games?

You can stream all in-market San Diego Padres games with a PADRES.TV subscription. Select games will also air nationally on FOX, FS1, ESPN, MLB Network, and TBS, with some streaming on Apple TV+ and The Roku Channel.

If you live beyond the Padres’ TV market, you can get an MLB.TV or MLB EXTRA INNINGS subscription for out-of-market access to all games that air on PADRES.TV.

How much does PADRES.TV cost?

To start the 2025 season, PADRES.TV is available for $19.99 per month or $99.99 for the whole season. This subscription lets you stream all in-market San Diego Padres games live and on demand. Of course, you must live within the team’s broadcast territory, which includes portions of California, Arizona, Nevada, New Mexico, and Hawaii.

If you live in those regions but prefer traditional cable or satellite TV, you can watch in-market games on the MLB San Diego Padres TV channel via DIRECTV, Spectrum TV, or Cox.

For fans outside the Padres’ home market, MLB.TV continues to offer out-of-market coverage. But keep in mind that national blackouts apply to PADRES.TV and MLB.TV when Padres games air exclusively on channels like FOX, FS1, and Apple TV+.

You can watch a handful of Padres Spring Training games for free on PADRES.TV through the MLB app. But as for the 2025 regular season, your best free options are with an over-the-air (OTA) antenna, Free Game of the Day on MLB.TV, or a free streaming trial.

An OTA antenna gives you unrestricted access to all San Diego Padres games aired on FOX. To watch The Friar’s games on FOX for free every season going forward, make sure to grab a highly-rated antenna.

If you create an account on MLB.com, you can watch several Padres games during the regular season at no cost with Free Game of the Day on MLB.TV. Check each morning which MLB game is streaming free that day.

Our last-at-bat suggestion is to hop on a free live TV streaming trial with DIRECTV STREAM or Fubo. Then, you can stream free MLB games for up to one week.

Our sports experts created this viewing guide for San Diego Padres fans to watch every Spring Training and regular-season game this year. item.title: The Ultimate Guide To Watching the New York Yankees in 2025
item.dc:creator: Chantel Buchi
item.description:
Learn how to watch every New York Yankees game on TV this MLB season with our viewing guide: featuring game times, channel listings, and more.

The post The Ultimate Guide To Watching the New York Yankees in 2025 appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
Stream Free on DIRECTV

I know you’re excited to watch the New York Yankees this postseason. They’re first test comes against their biggest rivals, the Boston Red Sox, in the American League Wild Card series.

The Yankees were a full five games ahead of the Red Sox in the regular season standings. But all that is moot in the postseason. All the Yankees have to do is win two home games, and they advance. But Boston will go out swinging.

Find out how to catch every Yankees game on TV this postseason with my complete watch guide.

Jump to:

  • New York Yankees TV schedule
  • New York Yankees channels
  • Spring Training schedule
  • Watch the Yankees for free

Want more TV sports coverage?

By signing up, you agree to our Privacy Policy & Terms and Conditions.

2025 New York Yankees playoffs TV schedule

The New York Yankees began their regular season against the Milwaukee Brewers on March 27. Now, with Opening Day in the rearview, Aaron Judge, Gerrit Cole, and Giancarlo Stanton are locked in for another exciting year in the Bronx.

If you don’t live near New York or don’t get access to the regional sports network, YES Network, you’ll need MLB.TV or MLB EXTRA INNINGS to watch games aired on this RSN.

Yankees fans will want ESPN for Sunday Night Baseball games and the Aaron Judge–Shohei Ohtani matchup in June. You’ll also want to subscribe to Prime Video to watch 20+ in-market Yankees games and Apple TV+ to access various Friday Night Baseball matchups.

Need faster internet to support streaming live MLB games?

No Yankee fan wants their stream to pause in the middle of a tied ninth inning. Enter your zip code below to find the best internet providers near you.

How can I watch the Yankees’ Spring Training games?

YES Network and The Gotham Sports App will show most of the New York Yankees 2025 Spring Training games. Depending on your location, you can also watch some preseason matchups on MLB Network, ESPN, and ESPN+.

We’ll update the TV schedule as more information becomes available, but in the meantime, get your game-watching area prepared.

MLB.TV’s Free Game of the Day allows you to watch a handful of free Yankees games during the regular season. Create an account on MLB.com and check in the morning which game you can stream that day.

And lastly, you can sign up for a free live TV streaming trial with DIRECTV STREAM, Fubo, and YouTube TV. Keep in mind that DIRECTV STREAM is the only live TV streaming service with the YES Network.

How to watch New York Yankees FAQ

What day is Opening Day for Yankees 2025?

Opening Day for the New York Yankees is on Thursday, March 27, at 3:05 p.m. ET against the Milwaukee Brewers. The home opener will air exclusively on ESPN.

How can I watch the Yankees games in 2025?

The New York Yankees 2025 regular season games will air on FOX, FS1, ESPN, MLB Network, TBS, and YES Network. Select regional games will stream on Amazon Prime Video, while some national matchups will appear on Apple TV+. If you support the Yankees far away from New York, you’ll need MLB.TV or MLB EXTRA INNINGS to watch the YES games outside the Yankees’ home TV market.

Can I watch New York Yankees games without cable?

You can stream New York Yankees 2025 regular season games without cable using a live TV streaming service like DIRECTV STREAM, the only live TV streaming service with YES Network. YouTube TV, Fubo, and Hulu + Live TV have most channels a Yankee fan will need to stream MLB games. And Apple TV+ will feature Friday Night Baseball.

item.content:encoded:
Stream Free on DIRECTV

The Boston Red Sox and New York Yankees have one of the most storied rivalries in all of sports, and it will take center stage on ESPN for the American League Wild Card series.

The Red Sox and Yankees have a three-game series in New York starting Tuesday, September 30. I love a good rivalry, and I’ll be following this series with bated breath. If you want to follow along as well, keep reading this watch guide for TV channels, dates, and times for each game.

What channels have Boston Red Sox games?

Most Boston Red Sox games air locally on NESN and NESN+. But you’ll need access to FOX, FS1, ESPN, TBS, and MLB Network to watch nationally televised matchups, with some games also streaming on Apple TV+ and The Roku Channel.

MLB.TV and MLB EXTRA INNINGS show the NESN games for out-of-market fans.

Want radio coverage? MLB At Bat has live audio of every Red Sox game without location blackouts. New England–based listeners can also catch games on select AM and FM stations via the team’s radio affiliates.

2025 Boston Red Sox playoffs TV schedule

You can watch select Red Sox games for free on ABC and FOX with an over-the-air (OTA) antenna. Use the FCC’s Reception Map Tool to find channels in your area, then visit our Best OTA Antennas page for recommended hardware. We like the Mohu Leaf 50 for its amplified 60-mile range and multi-directional design.

You can also take advantage of free daily MLB games on MLB.TV using a standard MLB.com account. Otherwise, services like DIRECTV STREAM, Fubo, and YouTube TV often offer free streaming trials.

How to watch the Boston Red Sox FAQ

What streaming service has Red Sox games?

All live TV streaming services with national MLB channels show some Red Sox games, but Fubo and DIRECTV STREAM are the only ones that offer NESN. You can also stream live games via NESN 360 and MLB.TV—depending on your location.

What is the cheapest way to watch the Red Sox?

The cheapest way to watch the Red Sox depends on your location and the amount of games you want to see. An OTA antenna can get you some games without a monthly TV subscription. But NESN 360 is the best in-market service, while MLB.TV is ideal for out-of-market fans—both cost $29.99 a month to start the season.

How can I watch NESN live?

NESN is available through many New England–based cable providers and DIRECTV. In-market viewers can also stream the channel via NESN 360, Fubo, and DIRECTV STREAM.

Can I watch the Red Sox on YouTube TV?

Yes, you can watch nationally televised Red Sox games on YouTube TV that air on FOX, FS1, ESPN, and TBS. Unfortunately, YouTube TV doesn’t offer MLB Network or MLB.TV as an add-on.

How can I watch the Red Sox on Sling TV?

You can watch nationally televised Red Sox games on Sling TV. But you’ll need the Sling Orange + Blue plan to get ESPN and FOX Sports channels together, while MLB Network is available in the Sports Extra add-on.

Why you should trust us

Our sports experts meticulously reviewed this year’s Boston Red Sox schedule by compiling game times and channel listings. We used that data to compare MLB viewing options for Red Sox fans by examining popular TV providers’ pricing, channel lineups, and features.

Check out our How We Rank page to learn more about our methods.

item.title: How To Watch the 2025 Cleveland Guardians Season
item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Finn
item.description:
Guard the land and the remote! Our guide has the full 2025 Guardians TV schedule, channel breakdowns, and the best TV providers for watching every game live.

The post How To Watch the 2025 Cleveland Guardians Season appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
The Cleveland Guardians have a solid opportunity to advance to the American League Division Series with home-field advantage in the Wild Card. But they’ll have to do it against a Detroit Tigers team that was just one game behind them in the regular season standings.

The playoffs are some of the most exciting times in all of sports, let alone the MLB. Are you Guardians fans ready for October baseball? I know I am. Keep reading to find out how you can watch every Cleveland pitch, at-bat, and stolen base on TV this postseason.

Jump to:

  • Cleveland Guardians channels
  • Best Cleveland Guardians TV plans
  • Cleveland Guardians TV schedule
  • Watch Cleveland Guardians for free

Want more TV sports coverage?

Subscribe to CableTV.com’s email newsletter for the latest event-viewing guides, entertaining takes, and money-saving promotions.

By signing up, you agree to our Privacy Policy & Terms and Conditions.

What channels have Cleveland Guardians games?

CLEGuardians.TV is the primary broadcast source for in-market fans watching Cleveland Guardians games during the 2025 MLB season. This service is available as a standalone streaming subscription in the MLB app and is also accessible through DIRECTV, Fubo, Spectrum, and Cox.

National networks such as Apple TV+, ESPN, FOX, MLB Network, and The Roku Channel will televise select Guardians games to audiences across the country.

Any fans who don’t live within the Guardians’ broadcast region will need MLB.TV (streaming) or MLB EXTRA INNINGS (cable/satellite) to watch those exclusive CLEGuardians.TV games.

Want radio coverage? You can catch all Cleveland Guardians games live on WTAM 1100 AM and WMMS 100.7 FM in Cleveland, with Tom Hamilton and Jim Rosenhaus calling the action. The Guardians Radio Network also includes 29 affiliates across the region, and fans can stream games on SiriusXM, TuneIn Premium, or MLB At Bat.

Best TV plans for watching the Cleveland Guardians

The Guardians ditched the traditional RSN route and now offer CLEGuardians.TV, which is a blackout-free, in-market streaming service that’s as straightforward as a José Ramírez line drive. That’s where you’re going to get to tune in to over 150 games, so you’d be in good hands.

For a complete package, I recommend DIRECTV’s CHOICE streaming plan. It includes CLEGuardians.TV on channel 662 for local fans, plus all the national MLB channels for those marquee matchups.

Just a heads-up: About 15 games this season will air exclusively on national platforms like FOX, ESPN, TBS, Roku, and Apple TV+. So if you want every pitch, you’ll need to add those to your lineup.

Standalone in-market TV package for Guardians games

If you live in Northeast Ohio, then you’ve got a streamlined way to watch the Cleveland Guardians in 2025—no cable or satellite required. Just subscribe to CLEGuardians.TV directly. The direct-to-consumer streaming service is available through the MLB app or online at CLEGuardians.TV.

For $99.99 a year or $19.99 a month, you’ll get access to 151 regular-season games, all blackout-free and available live or on demand. It’s the easiest way to follow the Guardians if you’re in-market and want to skip the traditional TV setup.

Score the best TV plan!

Enter your zip code below to see your area’s top TV providers.

2025 Cleveland Guardians playoffs TV schedule

Now that the regular season is over, all eyes turn to the Wild Card series. The Cleveland Guardians have three tries to win two games against the Detroit Tigers, who won just five of the 13 matchups between the two teams.

The Guardians have every game of the series at home, so that should be an advantage. But anything can happen in a best-of-three situation. Check out the full schedule below, and keep checking up on this page for more updates.

How to watch the Cleveland Guardians FAQ

How can I watch Cleveland Guardians’ in-market games in 2025?

The Guardians no longer have a traditional RSN like Bally Sports Great Lakes. Instead, in-market fans can watch games via select local broadcast affiliates and a new team-operated streaming service called CLEGuardians.TV. National games still air on ESPN, FOX, Apple TV+, and MLB Network.

What’s the best way to stream Guardians games if I live outside Ohio?

Out-of-market fans can subscribe to MLB.TV, which offers streaming access to all games not nationally televised. It’s ideal for Guardians fans living beyond the eastern Great Lakes region.

Can I watch Cleveland Guardians games for free?

Some Cleveland Guardians games stream free in the MLB app during special promos. Platforms like Roku occasionally offer free national games, while local fans can catch free games over the air on WKYC using a digital antenna.

Who are the best players on the Cleveland Guardians?

Top Guardians players include José Ramírez, Bo Naylor, Steven Kwan, and pitchers Tanner Bibee and Gavin Williams. Prospects like Travis Bazzana, Chase DeLauter, Jaison Chourio, and Angel Genao promise an exciting future.

Why you should trust us

Our CableTV.com Contributing Writer, Creshonda Smith, crafted this guide with Cleveland Guardians fans in mind—especially those who never miss a pitch. After combing through every scheduled broadcast and exploring each viewing option, she built a simple, reliable roadmap so you know exactly where and how to tune in for every Guardians game this season.

Check out our How We Rank page to learn more about our methods.

Game day starts here!

  • Best Streaming Services for Sports

item.title: How To Watch the 2025 Detroit Tigers Season
item.dc:creator: David Vick
item.description:
The good times have returned to Comerica Park! Follow the Detroit Tigers on TV all season long with our unbeatable watch guide.

The post How To Watch the 2025 Detroit Tigers Season appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
October baseball is here, and Detroit Tigers fans need to get ready. The Tigers earned a Wild Card spot in the American League, and are just two wins away from starting their playoff journey in earnest. Their first opponent: Cleveland.

Keep it here throughout the postseason, where I’ll be updating the viewing options for every Detroit game as the team advances through the playoffs.

Jump to:

  • Detroit Tigers channels
  • Best ways to watch the Tigers
  • Detroit Tigers TV schedule

Want more TV sports coverage?

Subscribe to CableTV.com’s email newsletter for the latest event-viewing guides, entertaining takes, and money-saving promotions.

By signing up, you agree to our Privacy Policy & Terms and Conditions.

What channels have Detroit Tigers games?

When the Detroit Tigers aren’t playing in front of national audiences on Apple TV+, ESPN, FOX, FS1, and MLB Network, fans can watch their games on FanDuel Sports Network Detroit (FDSDET).

If FDSDET is unavailable where you live, you’ll need MLB.TV or MLB EXTRA INNINGS to watch out-of-market Tigers games.

Want radio coverage? You can listen to every Tigers game on 97.1 FM The Ticket or an affiliate near you. Spanish broadcasts are also available for home games on LaZ 1310 AM and 107.9 FM.

Best TV plans for watching the Detroit Tigers

Outside of streaming-exclusive games on Apple TV+, only a few TV providers carry all the channels local fans need to watch every Detroit Tigers game this season. Of the options, my top pick is Fubo. Its Pro plan—the most affordable package Fubo offers—has everything you need. This means you don’t have to upgrade or get any add-ons to watch your Tigers, but you’ll have a regional sports fee for FDSDET access.

If you prefer a more traditional provider, DIRECTV is a good option. It has all the channels the Tigers will play on, but you’ll need to sign up for the Choice package to get FanDuel Sports Network. This will cost about $5 more per month than Fubo before any regional sports fees.

Unsure which one to pick? Take advantage of the free streaming trials both providers offer to find the one that’s best for you.

Standalone in-market TV package for Tigers games

If you’re a local fan who doesn’t want a full-blown TV provider to watch the Tigers in 2025, a subscription to FanDuel Sports Network is the way to go. This will let you watch every regular-season game that isn’t nationally televised. After subscribing, you can watch games online or in the FanDuel Sports Network app.

Score the best TV plan!

Want to browse more TV options? Enter your zip code below to see your area’s top TV providers.

2025 Detroit Tigers playoffs TV schedule

The Detroit Tigers have their work cut out for them in the American League Wild Card series. They’ll need to win two games on the road in the best-of-three series against the Cleveland Guardians to get into the division series against the Seattle Mariners.

Here’s the full schedule of the Wild Card series, including dates and times. Every game will air on ESPN.

How to watch the Detroit Tigers FAQ

Can I watch the Detroit Tigers for free?

Yes, you can watch the Detroit Tigers for free with an over-the-air antenna when games air on national channels. Use the FCC’s Reception Map Tool to find the channels that are available where you live.

Are Detroit Tigers games available on Amazon Prime Video?

Yes, most Detroit Tigers games are available on Prime Video through add-on channels. Local fans need to buy the FanDuel Sports Network add-on, while out-of-market fans must purchase the MLB.TV add-on. Additionally, the Tigers–Yankees matchup on September 10 will stream on Prime Video at no extra cost for Prime subscribers who live in the Yankees’ TV market.

Will Tigers games be on ESPN after the 2025 season?

Possibly. Major League Baseball and ESPN previously announced that they would not renew their media rights deal after the 2025 season, but recent reports indicate the two sides are now discussing a possible extension.

Is there a FanDuel Sports Network app?

Yes, there is a FanDuel Sports Network app for streaming Tigers games. It’s available on Apple and Android devices, as well as several different streaming platforms.

Why you should trust us

Our CableTV.com Contributing Writer, David Vick, created this watch guide with the specific viewing needs of Detroit Tigers fans in mind. After spending a few hours researching the most up-to-date broadcast schedule for the Tigers’ 2025 season, he determined the most ideal and affordable viewing options for fans. Before publishing, David carefully reviewed every detail in this guide to ensure its accuracy and completeness.

Check out our How We Rank page to learn more about our methods.

Game day starts here!

item.title: How To Watch the 2025 NHL Preseason
item.dc:creator: Taylor Kujawa
item.description:
Before the NHL regular season begins, each team will compete in a series of preseason matchups starting in September. We dusted off our skates to deliver a complete look at how to watch this year’s NHL preseason.

The post How To Watch the 2025 NHL Preseason appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
Stream Free on DIRECTV

Before the puck drops on the 2025–2026 NHL regular season, each team will compete in a series of preseason matchups starting September 20, 2025. NHL Network and TNT will televise select games nationwide, but most preseason hockey action airs on regional sports networks (RSNs).

Stream with DIRECTV is my favorite service for catching the NHL preseason. It comes with every national NHL channel and offers most RSNs based on your location. But if you support a team far from home, you’ll want ESPN+ for out-of-market streaming access.

Keep reading for more info on NHL preseason channels and recommended TV services. We also have a section dedicated to the full preseason schedule so you can quickly check game times.

Jump to:

  • NHL preseason channels
  • NHL preseason TV schedule
  • Best NHL preseason TV plans
  • Watch the NHL preseason for free

Don’t miss preseason hockey on TV!

Score the best TV plan in your area by entering your zip code below.

What channels are NHL preseason games on?

NHL preseason channels are a bit of a mixed bag. Most games air locally on regional sports networks or stream with geo-restrictions on each team’s official website. NHL Network and TNT broadcast some matchups nationwide, and you can stream many out-of-market preseason games on ESPN+.

Want radio coverage? While not all NHL preseason games appear on TV, you can listen to game audio through team radio affiliates online via TuneIn.

2025 NHL preseason schedule

This year’s NHL preseason runs from September 21 to October 5. Like previous seasons, the two-week period includes neutral-site exhibition games happening domestically and internationally. Buffalo Sabres fans in Germany will get a special treat as the NHL Global Series makes a preseason stop at SAP Garden in Munich.

Best TV plans for watching the NHL preseason

The best TV plans for watching the NHL preseason depend on the games you wish to see. If you prefer having access to every preseason duel, you’ll want DIRECTV STREAM and ESPN+.

DIRECTV STREAM will get you every national NHL channel and your regional sports network, while ESPN+ provides out-of-market access. Together, DIRECTV STREAM with a standalone ESPN+ subscription is the most expensive route for NHL fans. It’s also unnecessary if you want only the televised games featuring your favorite team. In that case, you may look to one of these options:

  1. Local games: Watching locally televised NHL preseason games is tricky because every team has different TV affiliates. In most cases, you’ll need a TV provider like DIRECTV STREAM or Fubo to get RSN access. Otherwise, depending on your local team’s broadcaster, a simple TV antenna can pick up games over the air.
  2. Out-of-market games: ESPN+ and NHL Center Ice carry out-of-market NHL games. You won’t get every out-of-market preseason game because not every game airs on TV, but ESPN+ is a great streaming option for only $10.99 a month.
  3. National games: Sling TV is the cheapest way to get national NHL channels like ESPN, NHL Network, and TNT. All you’ll need is the Sling Orange plan ($45.99/mo.) and the Sports Extra add-on ($11.00/mo.).

Which TV providers carry NHL preseason games?

Any TV plan offering NHL Network and TNT will get you nationally televised NHL preseason games. To help your search, we listed 13 popular TV services in the table below and illustrated whether they carry the two channels.

How to watch the NHL preseason for free

Unfortunately, no straightforward viewing methods exist to watch NHL preseason games for free. In some metropolitan areas with NHL teams, you might catch a few matchups using an over-the-air (OTA) antenna—such as KMCC in Las Vegas airing Vegas Golden Knights preseason games. However, this option is not viable for most NHL fans, especially if you don’t live near your favorite team.

While scouring Reddit for free NHL streams is possible, we don’t endorse that approach due to its illegality, unreliability, and potential risks to your streaming device. Instead, a legitimate and inexpensive option is subscribing to ESPN+ at $11.99 a month, which will provide access to many matchups with no additional commitments.

Are all NHL preseason games on TV?

Most NHL preseason games appear on TV or online, although some matchups may not have an official broadcast. Regional blackout restrictions can also prevent certain games from airing in your area.

For in-market coverage, you’ll need a TV plan with your local team’s regional sports network. You can also explore out-of-market options like ESPN+ and NHL Center Ice if you support a non-local team. In cases where no viewing option is available, games are typically still accessible through each team’s radio partner.

How to watch the NHL preseason FAQ

Can you stream NHL preseason games?

Yes, you can stream NHL preseason games on any live TV streaming service that offers NHL Network, TNT, and your local team’s RSN affiliate. ESPN+ also carries select out-of-market games during the preseason.

Are NHL preseason games blacked out?

Yes, broadcasting blackouts occur for all locally televised NHL preseason games. In-market games will appear on RSNs, while ESPN+ and NHL Center Ice will show some out-of-market matchups.

Does NHL Center Ice include preseason games?

Yes, NHL Center Ice carries select out-of-market preseason games. Unlike the regular season, NHL Center Ice doesn’t offer complete out-of-market access during the preseason. Blackout restrictions may also prevent certain games from airing in your area.

Where can I watch NHL preseason games in Canada?

In Canada, some NHL preseason games air nationally on Sportsnet, Sportsnet ONE, and TSN. Sportsnet+ (formerly Sportsnet NOW) will show select out-of-market preseason games, while in-market games may appear on TSN’s regional networks and individual team websites.

Why you should trust us

Our CableTV.com sports editor, Taylor Kujawa, conducted thorough research and hands-on testing to identify the best ways to watch this year’s NHL preseason. He compiled a comprehensive list of preseason matchups and channel listings. Utilizing that data, he compared popular TV providers to determine the most efficient way to watch the most games—considering in-market, out-of-market, and nationally televised broadcasts.

Check out our How We Rank page to learn more about our methods.

Game day starts here!

item.title: 650 Hours of Horror: How to Watch AMC’s FearFest 2025
item.dc:creator: Randy Harward
item.description:
The 31 Nights of Halloween are back! From October 1–31, you’ll be able to enjoy your favorite spooky classics every day on the Freeform channel.

The post 650 Hours of Horror: How to Watch AMC’s FearFest 2025 appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
Watch Free on Fubo

What is AMC’s FearFest 2025?

AMC’s FearFest is an annual event where AMC and AMC+ airs and streams 650 hours of horror movies, TV series, specials, and more throughout October. Like last year, AMC FearFest 2025 will be hosted by artist/musician/horror aficionado Janelle Monáe, who AMC is calling FearFest’s “HalloQueen.”

In addition to hosting, Monáe has also curated a list of her favorite freaky films including, The Birds, Carrie (1976), Child’s Play (1988), the original Halloween (1978), Jeepers Creepers, Late Night with the Devil, Leprechaun, The Others, Psycho (1960), and more. Other  FearFest programming includes franchise marathons (A Nightmare on Elm Street, Final Destination, Friday the 13th, and Halloween) and curated days dedicated to ’80s horror, creature features, and Stephen King.

I’ve included the complete schedule—all 175 lines of it—below. Happy FearFest!

Don’t let laggy internet spoil AMC’s FearFest 2025

Enter your zip code below to see faster internet providers in your area.

Complete AMC FearFest schedule (2025)

Where to watch AMC FearFest 2025

This one’s a no-brainer: FearFest will air live on AMC and stream on AMC+. In order to watch, you’ll need a cable TV or live streaming TV package that carries AMC, or an AMC+ subscription. Fortunately, you can find AMC with most streaming services and TV providers.

Calling all ghouls . . .

Do you love having the holy crap scared out of you? So do we. Check out our #Bloodstream hub for all things freaky.

I’ve compiled a list of top TV plans that include AMC in their channel lineups. You’ll find a variety of TV providers, services, and deals (free trials, cheap plans, etc.), so you can choose the right plan for you and your household.
